We’re a diverse group of down-to-earth, straightforward people with a passion for home furnishing. WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU

You have 3 years experience of working in a retail and/or logistics role, including previous experience of leading others
You have problem-solving experience

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING DAY TO DAY

Responsible for planning, organizing and monitoring store goods flow process from goods receiving to sales locations replenishment within my area of responsibility, contributing to fulfillment of the goal to be ready before store opening
Responsible for ensuring all prerequisites are met in my area of responsibility, including resources, tools, working methods and internal communication, to contribute to an efficient range administration process in my store (space dimensioning, goods allocation)
Lead and manage my team in coordinating and optimizing goods flow operations in my store, resulting in agreed goods availability for customers at the lowest possible costs
Contribute to ensuring that store stock is available for customers in order to maximize sales by  performing sales space replenishment according to the guidance of Sales Team & Communications and Interior Design Team
Work actively to improve productivity by efficient resource planning including managing the quality  of staff planning, flexibility of working and implementing efficient goods flow operations  
Minimize handling damages in my store and working with my manager to identify the root cause of recurring damages and identifying ways to minimize future recurrence
Observe the performance of contractors who deliver stocks from the Distribution Center to stores, and report any dis satisfactory contractor issues to the Distribution Center team
Give input to my goods flow manager for the creation of business plan and goods flow action plans
Analyze the results of the Customer Satisfaction Survey, Voice and Commercial Reviews and using the insights gained from this to develop our business
Commit to the development of my team. I work with my manager to secure the training of my team to ensure they are well informed, regarding coordination and optimization of goods flow operations

Annual Fixed Bonus, 5-Day Work Week, 17 days Public Holiday, Paid Leave (Paid Annual Leave, 14 weeks Maternity Leave, 5 days Paternity Leave, 1 week Marriage Leave), Employee Medical Coverage, Non-Contributory Retirement Plan, Staff Purchase Discount, Birthday Coupon, Referral Bonus, Excellent Career Path
